tool.name: Generate a heat map
tool.description: of a flow analysis using Clustergrammer

exit_code.description: Please provide a comma-separated list of indices.
Indices within one of the categories are used several times.
Please provide indices within the range of your input matrix.

tool.command: mkdir templates && mkdir -p static/flowtools && FLOWTOOL=`which clustergrammerIPG.py` && FLOWTOOLDIR=$(dirname ${FLOWTOOL}) && cp $FLOWTOOLDIR/../share/templates/clus* templates/ && cp -r $FLOWTOOLDIR/../share/static/flowtools/* static/flowtools/ && clustergrammerIPG.py' '${input_matrix}' '${html_file}' '${html_file.files_path}' 'templates/' #for $category in $cat 'new_cat' '${category.roc}' '${category.cat_title}' '${category.label1}' '${category.indices1}' #for $catlabel in $category.cat_labels 'new_label' '${catlabel.label}' '${catlabel.indices}' #end for #end for

param.name: input_matrix
param.label: Centroids file
param.help: Any type of input matrix can be used.

param.name: roc
param.label: Is this category for row data or column data?

param.name: indices1
param.label: Indices of rows or columns this label should be given to.

param.name: indices
param.label: Indices of rows or columns this label should be given to.

tool.help:
This tool generates a heat map from the provided input matrix using Clustergrammer.
-----
**Input**
Please provide a tab-separated matrix of values as input, for instance a centroid file from a FLOCK analysis. Rows and columns can be annotated by setting up categories and labels for each group within categories.
.. class:: infomark
Any type of matrix can be used but the datatype expected by this tool is flowmfi. You can modify the file format of any file in your history by clicking on the pencil next to the name of your file, and going to the 'Datatype' tab.
**Graphical output**
The output is an interactive heat-map of the matrix provided.
-----
**Example**
*Input*: Centroids file::
Population Marker1 Marker2 Marker3 1 38 49 10 2 21 63 100 3 31 52 45 4 11 78 25
*Interactive Graphical output*
.. image:: ./static/images/flowtools/clustergrammer.png
-----
Clustergrammer_ is a project from the Ma'ayan lab. Find them on GitHub_, more info here_.
.. _Clustergrammer: http://amp.pharm.mssm.edu/clustergrammer/ .. _GitHub: https://github.com/MaayanLab/clustergrammer .. _here: https://clustergrammer.readthedocs.io/getting_started.html
